definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
eyes brimming with tears of excitement (idiom)/extremely moved

sentences.english: With tear-filled eyes, I turned the machine off.
sentences.chinese: 我热泪盈眶地关掉了电脑。

sentences.english: The hot tears spattered out of her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 热泪从她的眼中洒落了下来。

sentences.english: The rear passenger compartment alone is enough to make experienced cops get teary-eyed.
sentences.chinese: 单是后乘客室就足以令有经验的警察感动地热泪盈眶。

sentences.english: eg: At this point all of us were burst into tears.
sentences.chinese: 此时我们所有人都热泪盈眶。

sentences.english: Poor Shin had me in tears watching her.
sentences.chinese: 可怜的申雅岚让我在电视前热泪盈眶。

sentences.english: She cried hot tears upon the book.
sentences.chinese: 她哭得热泪都滴到书上了。

sentences.english: Cross, on a respirator , responded the only way he could -- with tears.
sentences.chinese: 克罗斯戴着一个呼吸器，只能用热泪作为回应。

sentences.english: The green lawns brought tears to my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 看着眼前绿茵茵的草坪，我不禁热泪盈眶。

sentences.english: ZhangLiHua finally shed tears robot into the YangGuang arms.
sentences.chinese: 最终张丽华流下热泪扑进了杨广的怀里。

sentences.english: I watched it carefully, tear in eye.
Her eyes filled with tears of joy.
sentences.chinese: 她的眼眶里饱含着幸福的热泪。

sentences.english: Seeing those tiny bones brought her to tears.
sentences.chinese: 看着这些纤细的骨头，她激动地热泪盈眶。

sentences.english: Tears of love filled up her eyes when she saw her first husband down below.
sentences.chinese: 当她看到城墙下前夫的身影时，爱的热泪流满了眼帘。

sentences.english: Her tears poured forth as she watched the sad scene.
sentences.chinese: 当她看到这悲凉的情景时热泪纵横。

sentences.english: The water stood in my eyes to hear this avowal of his dependence;
sentences.chinese: 听完他表示对别人的依赖，我不禁热泪盈眶。

sentences.english: Status Offline The rear passenger compartment alone is enough to make experienced cops get teary-eyed.
sentences.chinese: 单是后乘客室就足以令有经验的警察感动地热泪盈眶。

definition: eyes brimming with tears of excitement (idiom)/extremely moved
to choke with emotion/to choke with sobs
all sorts of feelings well up in one's heart
to bury one's head in one's hands and weep (idiom)
